qas.question: What was the first year the CIA's budget was disclosed?
Who disclosed the CIA's budget for 2005?
What group accidentally published the non CIA budget in 1994?
What plan appropriated $13.7 billion over five years?
What percent of the $13.7 billion did the CIA receive?

context: There were numerous previous attempts to obtain general information about the budget. As a result, it was revealed that CIA's annual budget in Fiscal Year <a0_0>1963<a0_0/> was US $550 million (inflation-adjusted US$ 4.3 billion in 2016), and the overall intelligence budget in FY 1997 was US $26.6 billion (inflation-adjusted US$ 39.2 billion in 2016). There have been accidental disclosures; for instance, <a1_0>Mary Margaret Graham<a1_0/>, a former CIA official and deputy director of national intelligence for collection in 2005, said that the annual intelligence budget was $44 billion, and in 1994 <a2_0>Congress<a2_0/> accidentally published a budget of $43.4 billion (in 2012 dollars) in 1994 for the non-military National Intelligence Program, including $4.8 billion for the CIA. After <a3_0>the Marshall Plan<a3_0/> was approved, appropriating $13.7 billion over five years, <a4_0>5%<a4_0/> of those funds or $685 million were made available to the CIA.
